caption: (Translated by Google) Excellent atmosphere and very good food. Thanks for your attention.  (Original) Excelente ambiente y muy buena comida. Gracias por la atención.

Not family friendly.  Unaccommodating of well behaved children.  On 12/27 the host was unwilling to seat us despite multiple open tables & telling folks in front of us that they have a lot of availability.

Hugo’s is intimate, warm, fresh, and a perfect of example of what it means to dine in Portland. Every visit has been superb - from the staff, to the changing menu options, to the general concern for food allergies and preferences. The food is also incredible! Highly recommend trying multiple cocktails and deserts. This is not the place to skip either of these treats. Highly recommended for locals and visitors alike. Reservations are also highly recommended as the space is small. This translates to a wonderful dining experience where the staff can focus on you and your table. Vegetarian/vegan and GF friendly although your options will be limited.
Average flavor profiles. Expect earthy shroom dishes with no palette cleansing.  Staff is excellent.

Hugo's Hits Every Note Perfectly  I cannot say enough good about the food, the atmosphere or the service.  The appetizers were exquisite, we had a mushroom salad that brought the taste of the out-of-doors to the table and a squash salad with duck confit that I can still taste.  It had the wonderful creamy sweetness of the squash, but there was this smoky, ducky flavor throughout. If you like oysters, you must order their "bar snack"  of marinated oysters.  The oysters were plump and delicious and the brine did not toughen them, it seems to make their taste even better (if that's possible!). We had the duck breast as a main course and it was tender, flavorful and maybe the best duck I"ve ever had; plus the pork with sunchokes which was excellent. The waiter chose wines to accompany our dishes and he did a great job. My only suggestion to you is not to over-order.  We ordered the bread and the cashews and the charcuterie board, all of which were great, but contributed to that sense you've eaten too much.  So be judicious in ordering so you can savor every bite.  The waiter suggested maybe 3-4 appetizers and 2 mains.  I think one of each would have been better, and left more room for dessert! A must-visit restaurant and our thanks to the many many staff that worked to get everything so right!

Portland is known for some of the most amazing restaurants! This place may be one of them but I’ll be never know... walk ins are not welcome... on a Friday at 8pm when the place was sparse at best. Reservation only apparently. So if you shop at Jjill and drive a Mercedes this place is likely for you. Otherwise keep looking... plenty of options in Portland
Great culinary experience with many options to try - a little overpriced in my opinion, but good none the less
Some of the best service I've ever had.
What a gem!
Low key chill place for fine dining. Had the lamb tartare.....delish!! prices were adequate for level of service and quality of food

We ordered the Chef’s table and it was fantastic. Each course was better than the last and a few courses even changed my wife’s mind on food that she thought she didn’t like (clams and mushrooms). I admit when they brought out the corn salad I was thinking “I guess I have to get through this before I get another course” but it turned out to be one of my favorites. Not cheap but this level of quality rarely is.

What a fantastic dining experience! My husband and I couldn’t have been happier with the Chefs tasting menu. Each dish was well thought out and cooked to perfection. The service was terrific was well. We really couldn’t have asked for a better meal.
Absolutely incredible. Service presentation everything!!
(Translated by Google) ewie ...  (Original) ewie...

Wandered in Saturday around 6 and we got lucky to get seats at the bar. Unusual menu but we figured out how to have 4 courses for $60/person. The tomato and melon salads were very novel, the mushroom tempura amazing, and main courses of chicken and cod were delicious. Inventive desserts. Service was team-based and well-timed. A great experience so next time we'll make a reservation!
Had awesome visit here sampled different things waiter was very helpful
Exceptional food, service, and atmosphere. We came to celebrate our honeymoon and we'll be back for subsequent anniversaries for years to come. A must stop on your Portland food and wine tour.
Such an amazing dining experience! The tasting menu is worth every penny.
Eclectic menu. Fabulous food. Farm to table restaurant.
Eclectic mix of flavors and textures  on a limited locally sourced menu. Small quiet comfortable booths and attentive service.
We went for their support of Barbara Bush Children's Hospital this month and are so glad we did. Superb meal! Perfect wine recommendation. Attentive service. Lovely space. Thank you all.

Some of the most creative dishes I've ever had the privilege to enjoy. Every plate was a surprise and a wonder. The chefs clearly absolutely outdid themselves. I would happily go back anytime I'm in town.
Fabulous!
Absolutely hands down the best food experience in Portland. Yes its expensive and yes it's worth every single penny.

I went here just a week ago and it was the best time iveiveI had at a restaurant in quite some time.  The atmosphere is a mix of hipster, modern, and classy, and I think it's great.  The service was pretty good, they stopped to explain what each dish was, and I believe it was the owner who answered our questions about the neighboring restuaresta that all share a kitchen.  But now the important part, the food. I am a very picky person when it comes to flavor.  But absolutely eveyeverything I had, I enjoyed (besides a cheese ice cream, it was kind of weird). I did have the Verizon up meal, so eveythever was kind of prefixed, but still very impressed.  All the foods mixed very well together, and if you want a classy yet chill night out, then I recommend this place.

It was amazing!!!  Haven't been in years and I was defenitly missing out.  We had a prix fixe menu for the night that was bursting with flavor in every bite.  We found ourselves discussing each course throughout the entire meal.  It is a must have  experience that I want to go back and back and back.

Wonderful contemporary American food, we go here every year for our anniversary. Staff is very friendly. The biscuits in particular are very good. The only thing we don't recommend is the beet sorbet, my fiance claims it tastes like dirt. Then again, she says that about all beet dishes. I'm more of a root guy myself and I liked it!
I need this place out.

My wife and I celebrated our 3 year anniversary here 10/10/18. The food was very interesting and tasted great. I tried to obtain more information about each dish from the waiter but he was extremely unhelpful. He acted pretentious when asked questions and gave 2 star service. I left him a good tip for his lack of service and friendliness. Service goes a long way and by his attitude it will keep us from coming back for awhile. Come on Portland match the service to the quality of food. Disappointed to say the least. Zack Davies
Extremely rude hostess and bartender -- never have we ever experienced such unproffesionalism from any establishment
Amazing food, great experience. 10/10
Great food and atmosphere - only complaint is the service was not very attentive - but that is not enough of a complaint to stop me from going back.
Really good atmosphere and staff. We had a great dinner and the apps were great.  Definitely a place we will come back too.

We experienced a Manhattan level of pretentiousness in maine of all places. We arrived early for our reservation hoping to get a drink at the bar and were ushered away until the hostess learned we had a dinner reservation.  Each dish seemed inconsistent. We were probably there on an off night because it was recommended so highly? All and all I feel like they take themselves too seriously.

The tasting menu and wine pairings was one of the best meals I have ever experienced. I was blown away by the freshness and overall quality of the dishes presented. In particular, the tuna belly was out of this world. Quick shoutout to Patrick, who was phenomenal at presenting the dishes and wines. He made the night very memorable.
Superb takes on acid, spice and fat.
Cool place and knowledgeable staff.  A must stop in the Portland Old Port.
Very well thought out and executed dishes.  Balance throughout.  Wine pairings off the ala carte menu were spot on and the mixologist produced exquisite spirits on request.

Portland, ME the new New York...reserving bar seats? As a Hotelier I will go out of my way to steer people clear of such pretentiousness, especially when there are establishments like The James Beard award winning Hunt and Alpine Club. Don’t waste your time.
I had the food tasting here. Its very good course set!!

Very controlling environment. Did not let us sit in vacant areas of the Bar and booths; I would understand if they were busy, however, these areas remained empty the whole time we were there 2.5 hrs.).

Really tasty and modern cusine. I had several seafood dishes and all were really good. My boyfriend had the excelIent charcuterie plate. Also, amazing and friendly service. I don't understand the bad rating here.
Simply wonderful. Beautiful space, excellent service and a great, great meal.

High end feel but wouldn't recommend if you're a tourist. We were just looking for a few small plates and felt pressured to order more food by our waiter. The food was good and small quantities like we wanted, but overpriced for what I'm used to paying for in NYC.

Whoever left the "way to salty" comment , disregard because of grammatical blindness. Which leads to "dead tongue" disease.. Our meal was perfectly paced, perfectly prepared, and delicious, start to finish. Personable wait staff; friendly without being overbearing. You can't miss here.
Great decor, pretty good service, but agree with previous reviews about the food being salty, not flavorful, and smallish portions (and we got the "large" serving)

Very disappointing, staff felt that they were doing me a favor for being there !  Flavors of the food were were quite bland or way to salty.    The experience was more than horrible !    I own a restaurant in Greenwich Connecticut and it is high end .....this was dreadful for  food and wait staff , thank god fore st restaurant was willing to take us after we left .

Had the "90 day aged" rib eye, which did not have the typical flavor and texture of either aged beef or even a non-aged rib eye cut.  Some parts of the meal were very good, but at these prices the quality should not be uneven.  Service was excellent, as were the drinks.  My advice: drinks and small plates, or just go elsewhere.

Second time at Hugo's and disappointed again. The curried goat dish was inedible, the cod dish had little taste although advertised as spicy. The cute idea of having three sardine cans filled with herring, mussels and oysters was more cute than tasty. Can't say anything positive except the service. Expensive evening with little positive to offer.
Top fine dining experience in Portland.  Chef tasting menu will impress even the most jaded of foodies.
Fantastic chef's choice + wine pairing. Good mix of familiar and unfamiliar elements to make interesting dishes accessible. Well curated beverage pairings.
Amazing food. Romantic atmosphere. Pricey but worth it.
Very good place for a cocktail. I had the Downeast Breeze and my bf had the Dry Cidah.

WORST DINING EXPERIENCE EVER, GO TO GRACE INSTEAD FOR SURE. We have been to Portland many times and come here mainly to try new restaurants. We were very excited to try Hugo's... and left, two hours later, very disappointed. The portions were very very small for the price (and no, we were not expecting an all-you-can-eat buffet). There is some complimentary stuff they bring through your dinner (a little fried fish, biscuits and chocolates at the end) and they tasted better than what we ordered... though it would have been nice to have 4 biscuits for a table of 4 people, but, hey, at this point, nothing could have salvaged this dinner. The service was not that good and when one of us told the waiter that his plate did not contain any clams (he told us that the Fruit de mer plate contained clams) the waiter was a little arrogant and said: «Of course, that is a clam, sir»... pointing to a dime-sized piece of clam under a large parsley leaf. We didn't even try desserts, because, honestly, why stay there a minute more? I think people who gave 5 stars to this restaurant are either friends of the staff, got a free dinner or enjoyed a whole other menu that we have not seen tonight. This is my first and only review on Google about a restaurant... I don't usually take the time to write them but if someone reads this and decides to go elsewhere, it will have been worth it.
Wow. What a fantastic experience. I came 3000 miles and I'd do it again.

We ended up in here due to a one hour wait next door at Eventide.  I'm so glad we did!  We worked out way through most of the appetizer menu while sipping on cocktails followed by Shipyard brews and then a digestif to go with a dessert I am about to select.  Everything was wonderful, but I would especially recommend the smoked pork chop.  My wife loved the salmon tartare,  and we both really enjoyed the chicken liver mousse.  We'll be back!
It was a fun and great experience. Don't go just for the food - go for the flare.

Eaten at thousands of restaurants in over a dozen country's and can't think of a worse experience. The food was very expensive and seemed like the chef was more cornered with trying something different and the "look" of the dish instead of the taste. Each dish had extremely unbalanced and clashing flavors. On top of that the service left a lot to be desired and when I called attention to my dissatisfaction with the food the staff couldn't have cared less. Never have I experienced such indifference to a dinner's enjoyment and concerns.  Luckily after a few courses we had the good sense to cut our losses and ask for the check and not continue the five course tasting menu.  We received very much the same attitude and responses from the manager on staff who had no desire to salvage the experience. It's unfortunate that in a town with such great food, that this restaurant leaves dinners with a bad impression of Portland food and hospitality. Skip this place and go to Fore St or one of the other great restaurants where they don't take their rating or customers for granted.

Enjoyed a wonderful birthday celebration for my son.  Staff treated us like royalty.  The food was absolutely amazing!!  Tastes, textures, variety, words cannot describe the palate.  Also provided us with many extra complimentary dishes!
This was our favorite restaurant in Portland but we were disappointed the last time we were there. It may have been an off night because we've had many spectacular meals here.

excellent food, the coffee is evidently good, but for the price I feel that one could go elsewhere and be equally wow'd. With that said I still feel that the experience and service is bar none some of the best in Portland. Definitely a spot to go for those very special occasions.

Tasting menu is the prize here.  It's excellent and inventive.  That said, there is something to be said for simplicity when it comes to seafood, which when you're in Maine should be your goal.  I'd rather eat 5 courses of lobster rolls from Eventide next door personally.
Top notch experience. Great food great staff. Thanks everyone!
One of the best meals I have ever had. Make reservations early if you plan to get a table. Worth every penny!

I'm not sure what happened to the people who rated this one star, because this was easily one of the best and most unique meals I have had.  Let's start with the obvious, this isn't a "value" play. The menu is fixed price and changes daily. The staff does a great job with service, and pacing between the courses is great. They seemed to break up longer dishes with smaller plates. The portions were appropriate and I left feeling full.  The actual dishes were impressively complex. Each dish seemed better than the next. Would highly recommend.
Excellent. Always a special occasion. Otherwise said, this is a restaurant like no other.
Always exquisite.
